_header: Almighty Lord our blissful king Jesu
_description: ‘The Aungelles Songe’ in the English translation of Deguileville’s Pèlerinage de l’âme — five stanzas rhyme royal

Bod770.First Lines:
[A]lmygty lord our blisful king ihesuþou mirrour of þee
                    fadir mageste…
Bod770.Last Lines:
…þe remenant is relesid of thi graceIn heuen an hiȝ
                    assigned is hem place

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
Almyghti god oure blyssed kyng IhesuÞu merrour of þe
                    fadres mageste…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…The remnaunt is relesed of þi graceIn heuene a boue
                    assyngnes her place

CULKk17.First Lines:
Almyȝti lord our blisful kyng Ihesuþou myrour of þe
                    fader mageste…
CULKk17.Last Lines:
…The remenaunt is relecyd of þi graceIn heuen on hiȝ
                    assigned is þeir place
CULKk17.Attributed Title:
Her endith þe drem of þe pilgrimage of þe soule (f.
                        124v)

CamGon124.First Lines:
Almyȝty lord oure blisful kyng Jhesuþu Mirrour of þe
                    fadir maieste…
CamGon124.Last Lines:
…þe reminaunt is relecid of þi graceIn heuen an hye
                    assygned is þeire place
CamGon124.Attributed Title:
What tym þat þes pilgrimes hadden songe in þis wyse
                    þeir aungels wich þat lade hem aunsuerd a noþer singe ful swet
                    & delicious & seid þus (p. 39)

BLAdd34193.First Lines:
All myghty lorde oure blissede kynge Ihesuþe merore of þe
                    fadures maieste…
BLAdd34193.Last Lines:
…þe remenaunte is relecede by þi graceIn heuene on
                    hye assignede is here place

BLEge615.First Lines: All myghti lord oure blisful lord IhuThu myroure of the fadier & maieste…
BLEge615.Last Lines: …The remenaunt is relessed of thi graceIn heuene is assigned hire place
BLEge615.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             “Hoccleve’s Works: The Regement of Princes and fourteen minor
                poems.” 
             EETS
         e.s. 72 (1897); repr. 1988: xxxiii-iv.

NYPLSpenc19.First Lines:
Almyghti lorde oure blisful lord IhesuThow myrrour of the fader in
                    maieste…
NYPLSpenc19.Last Lines:
…The remenaunt is relesed of thy graceIn heuene assigned is
                    her place
